definition: to wash/to clean out/to cleanse/to eliminate/to dredge
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Nina needs nine knitting needles to knit naughty Nita's knickers nicely.
sentences.chinese: 妮娜需要九个编织针为淘气的尼特编织漂亮的灯笼裤。

sentences.english: Occasionally, by now, Is lipped and called him Scampy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我说漏嘴，也叫它“小淘气”。

sentences.english: There must is someone who can take control of these naughty children.
sentences.chinese: 应该有人能管住这些淘气的孩子。

sentences.english: There's a mischievous look on her face.
The "parent" handles all responsibilities, while the "naughty child" has none.
sentences.chinese: “主”掌握所有的职责，而“小淘气”一概不管。

sentences.english: You'd speak to your little son;he's too mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 你得管教一下你的小儿子了，他也太淘气啦。

sentences.english: Parrorot is a vey naughty bird.
sentences.chinese: 英语是一支非常淘气的鸟。

sentences.english: A mean boy teases the dog.
sentences.chinese: 一个淘气的男孩在捉弄着狗。

sentences.english: The naughty boy happened to be playing video games when his father came in.
sentences.chinese: 那个淘气的孩子正在打电动时，父亲进去了。

sentences.english: Little rogue biting its tail just by her left ear.
sentences.chinese: 这个小淘气就在她左耳边咬住自己的尾巴。

sentences.english: These naughty kids have pulled off all the rose buds.
sentences.chinese: 这些淘气的孩子把所有玫瑰花蕾都摘掉了。

sentences.english: May: You are always so naughty.
Afraid of being scolded, the naughty boy ran away without turning off the water.
sentences.chinese: 害怕挨骂，那个淘气的男孩没关水龙头就跑了。

sentences.english: That child is a real imp.
We frolicked in the water like mischievous children.
sentences.chinese: 我在河里嬉戏，像个淘气的孩子。

sentences.english: You got yourselves into a lot of fist fights when you were small, and this scar is their legacy.
sentences.chinese: 因为你小时候太淘气打架，腿上才留下了这个疤拉。

definition: to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
